thread.title: We Didn't Make It Through The Oscar Red Carpet Without A 'Hidden Fences' Flub
thread.title_full: We Didn't Make It Through The Oscar Red Carpet Without A 'Hidden Fences' Flub

author: Julia Brucculieri
title: We Didn't Make It Through The Oscar Red Carpet Without A 'Hidden Fences' Flub
text:
We Didn't Make It Through The Oscar Red Carpet Without A 'Hidden Fences' Flub How hard is it to remember "Hidden Figures" AND "Fences"? By Julia Brucculieri 
“ Hidden Fences ” debuted at the Golden Globes earlier this year when both Jenna Bush Hager and Michael Keaton mixed up two of the year’s biggest films, “Hidden Figures” and “Fences,” and, unfortunately, combined them into one. On Sunday, “Hidden Fences” returned at the Oscars . 
This time, it was People’s editorial director, Jess Cagle, who made the unfortunate flub. Cagle corrected himself right away, but folks on Twitter didn’t let him get off too easy. 
Comedian Travon Free called him out: I knew we'd get our #HiddenFences before the night was over. #Oscars pic.twitter.com/NXpfg7JVmu — Travon Free (@Travon) February 27, 2017 
As did “Bad Feminist” author, Roxane Gay: Holy shit. The editor of People just said Hidden Fences. Pack it up folks. — roxane gay (@rgay) February 27, 2017 
And a few other folks: Jess Cagle, EIC of People Magazine just said "Hidden Fences" - take one shot — VICE Canada (@vicecanada) February 27, 2017 you know his internal monologue was like "don't say HIDDEN FENCES don't say HIDDEN FENCES don't say HIDDEN FENCES" *says HIDDEN FENCES* — alexander smith (@alexqsmith) February 27, 2017 Oh no look who's back at the #Oscars : Hidden Fences pic.twitter.com/zF1P8yAXoS — Mike Kalenderian (@ItsMikeKay) February 27, 2017 Omg poor Jess Cagle just said "Hidden Fences"--he corrected it immediately. A) I would likely do the same thing b) make a movie called that. — emily nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) February 27, 2017 We couldn't make it through the A-block of ABC's #Oscars coverage before someone said "Hidden Fences." Cool. #OscarsSoWhite
